basics.name: Andrew Van
basics.label: Senior Machine Learning Scientist @ Turing Medical
basics.summary: Magnetic Resonance Imaging, Image Science, Machine Learning/Deep Learning, NeuroImaging

work.summary: • Led the development of a visual programming application for Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS) surgical procedures, enhancing lead programming for clinicians and improving patient outcomes. • Built cloud-based neuroimaging pipelines for clinical targeting in movement-related disorders, improving processing efficiency and scalability for large unstructured patient datasets. • Engineered machine learning algorithms to address image segmentation and neuromodulation therapy challenges, in MR and CT imaging modalities. • Optimized R&D infrastructure to support cross-functional teams, ensuring smooth collaboration and faster iteration cycles, reducing product integration testing time from 6 months to 2 weeks. • Streamlined development workflows by implementing and maintaining Continuous Integration (CI) pipelines (GitHub Actions) across multiple repositories, automating manual deployments that spanned 1-2 weeks to 2-3 hours. • Conducted comprehensive verification & validation utilization with advanced statistical methodologies on multiple software tools, confirming compliance with industry standards (IEC 62304).

work.company: University of Pennsylvania Perelman School of Medicine
work.summary: • Investigated and validated novel MR sampling strategies for compressed sensing in the Siemens IDEA environment, achieving faster scan times and improved image reconstruction efficiency.

• Engineered novel off-resonance distortion correction methods for echo planar imaging, improving fMRI accuracy and reliability. • Developed Docker-containerized MRI preprocessing pipelines, enabling streamlined functional connectivity analyses across research projects. • Created 3D visualization software for examining spatial changes in functional connectivity, enhancing neural process analysis. • Trained deep learning models (GANs, CNNs) for data augmentation and image segmentation applications, enhancing fMRI preprocessing workflows. • Developed and maintained research infrastructure for lab group, including GitHub repos, CI pipelines, and storage of unstructured MRI imaging and behavioral data totaling over 10 TB. • Carried out administrative activities for several high performance linux servers for entire lab group.

• Streamlined analysis pipelines for structural and functional MRI data, leveraging Python, C/C++, M ATLAB, JavaScript (Node.js), and Bash to support cutting-edge neuroimaging studies. • Developed a real-time head motion tracking system (Framewise Integrated Real-Time MRI Monitor, FIRMM) for MRI scanners, culminating in a patented technology and a successful spin-off startup. • Implemented containerized applications using Docker and created deployment tools for cloud platforms (AWS, Heroku), improving scalability and collaboration across research teams.
• Examined mitochondrial function in the substantia nigra as a potential biomarker for Parkinson's Disease using 31-P Chemical Shift MRI data. Wrote an automated analysis pipeline in MATLAB.

• Developed control system for a custom Reflectance Confocal Microscopy imaging system using NI LabView. • Developed an image segmentation algorithm for segmenting cell nuclei in Reflectance Confocal Microscopy images using machine learning techniques.
• Conducted experiments optimizing a proof-of-concept dual-wavelength glucose biosensor design by synthesizing and testing various chemical compositions.
